questions.question: An infinite slab of thickness 'w' is having faces faces T1 and  T2, The fourier's equation for heat flow along x-direction is $$ frac{Q}{A} = -k \frac{\delta T}{\delta x} $$ Boundary conditions are x = 0, T = T<sub>1</sub> and x = w, T = T<sub>2</sub>. Q not equal to F(x), A not equal to F(x) and k is not equal to F(x). Q is given by :

Hollow sphere temperature varies such that at r = R, T = T<sub>R</sub>.Boundary condition at r = r_1 temperature T = T<sub>1</sub> and at r = r_2 temperature T = T<sub>2</sub>. and Q is given by $$ Q = \frac{4 \pi k (T_1 - T_R)}{\frac{1}{r_1} - \frac{1}{R}} $$ $$\frac{T_1 - T_R}{T_1 - T_2} \text{is given by}$$
